Name: StoryCampaignType
Description: In this campaign you will be working for the army.
Story: The enemy has a small base in the desert. It is very important to estimate the amount of troops the enemy has in that base. In order to do this, you must count the amount of tents/buildings the enemy has built there. Be careful! The enemy has tried to hide their buildings by putting them in the awning of the walls. Good luck!
Extra info: label: Mark each building by clicking it or drawing a shape around it
Extra info: label2: There were too many buildings to annotate
Extra info: label3: There are no tents/buildings in this image
Extra info: label5: Enter the total number of buildings here:

Story: The building count has given us a good sense of their numbers, well done. Now we need to know the blueprint of their main building, where we will begin our assault. We have used a satellite with X-ray vision to see the walls of the building. Put a marking on each room you see. Be careful! Some rooms might lie on top of other rooms and seem to overlap in the picture. Count these as two separate rooms.
Extra info: label: Mark each room by clicking it or drawing a shape around it
Extra info: label2: There were too many rooms to annotate
Extra info: label3: There are no rooms in this image
Extra info: label5: Enter the total number of rooms here:

Story: The blueprint you constructed in last assignment has given us a new insight: the people that are standing in the rooms can be seen in the x-ray photos as well! This would give us an even more accurate count of the amount of enemies in the base. Put a marking on each enemy you see. Be careful! Some enemies might seem to overlap since they are on different stories of the building. Count these as two separate enemies.
Extra info: label: Mark each enemy by clicking it or drawing a shape around it
Extra info: label2: There were too many enemies to annotate
Extra info: label3: There are no enemies in this image
Extra info: label5: Enter the total number of rooms here:

Story: Oh dear. Some people have made mistakes in marking the enemies. However, we don\'t know who made the mistakes. We would like you to go over this marking document and add any enemies that haven\'t been marked yet and delete any false markings. Keep in mind that we don\'t know who made the mistakes, so you might not find any mistakes!
Extra info: label: Mark each enemy by clicking it or drawing a shape around it
Extra info: label2: There were too many mistakes to annotate
Extra info: label3: There are no mistakes in this image
Extra info: label5: Enter the total number of enemies here:
